identificationModule.briefTitle: Study of BMS-477118 as Monotherapy With Titration in Subjects With Type 2 Diabetes Who Are Not Controlled With Diet and Exercise
identificationModule.officialTitle: A Multicenter, Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled, Phase 3 Trial to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of Saxagliptin as Monotherapy With Titration in Subjects With Type 2 Diabetes Who Have Inadequate Glycemic Control With Diet and Exercise

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The purpose of this trial is to understand if saxagliptin is more effective than placebo as a treatment for type 2 diabetic subjects who are not controlled with diet and exercise
descriptionModule.detailedDescription: All subjects will participate in a lead-in period, and qualifying subjects will continue into a short-term randomized treatment period. Subjects who complete the short-term period will be eligible to enter the long term extension period. Also, subjects in the short-term period who have an elevated blood sugar that requires additional medication for blood sugar control will be eligible to enter the long-term treatment extension period where they will receive metformin (rescue medication) added onto their blinded study medication

armGroups.description: PLUS open-label metformin (as needed as rescue medication)

armGroups.description: PLUS open-label metformin (as needed as rescue medication)

armGroups.description: PLUS open-label metformin (as needed as rescue medication)

interventions.name: Saxagliptin
interventions.description: Coated tablets, Oral, 2.5 mg, QAM, Daily (6 months ST, 12 months LT)

interventions.name: Saxagliptin
interventions.description: Coated tablets, Oral, 2.5 mg titrated to 5mg, QAM, Daily (6 months ST, 12 months LT)
armGroupLabels: Saxagliptin 2.5 mg titrated to 5 mg QAM (B)

interventions.name: Saxagliptin
interventions.description: Coated tablets, Oral, 5mg, QAM, Daily, (6 months ST, 12 months LT)

interventions.name: Saxagliptin
interventions.description: Coated tablets, Oral, 5mg QPM, Daily (6 months ST, 12 months LT)

interventions.name: Placebo
interventions.description: Coated tablets, Oral, 0mg, Daily (6 months ST, 12 months LT)

interventions.name: metformin
interventions.description: Tablets, Oral, 500-2000 mg, as needed (12 months LT)
armGroupLabels: Saxagliptin 2.5 mg titrated to 5 mg QAM (B)

primaryOutcomes.measure: Change From Baseline in Hemoglobin A1 (A1C) at Week 24
primaryOutcomes.description: Mean change from baseline in A1C at Week 24, adjusted for baseline value.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change From Baseline in A1C at Week 24 - Saxagliptin 5 mg QPM
secondaryOutcomes.description: Mean change from baseline in A1C at Week 24, adjusted for baseline value.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change From Baseline in Fasting Plasma Glucose (FPG) at Week 24
secondaryOutcomes.description: Mean change from baseline in FPG at Week 24, adjusted for baseline value.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Percentage of Participants Achieving A1C < 7% at Week 24
secondaryOutcomes.description: Percentage of participants achieving A1C \< 7%, the American Diabetes Association's defined goal for glycemia, at each dose of saxagliptin versus placebo at Week 24.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Changes From Baseline in Postprandial Glucose (PPG) Area Under the Curve (AUC) Response to an Oral Glucose Tolerance Test (OGTT) at Week 24
secondaryOutcomes.description: Mean change from baseline for 0 to 180 minutes PPG AUC at Week 24, adjusted for baseline value.

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Type 2 diabetes
* Inadequate blood sugar control

Exclusion Criteria:

* Previous treatment for diabetes
* Current treatment with other medications to lower blood sugar
* Major heart, liver or kidney problems
* Women who are pregnant or breastfeeding

locations.facility: Clinical Reseacrh Advantage/ Brown Family Medicine
Kansas City University Of Medicine And Biosciences
Texas Center For Drug Development, P.A.

references.citation: Perl S, Cook W, Wei C, Iqbal N, Hirshberg B. Saxagliptin Efficacy and Safety in Patients With Type 2 Diabetes and Moderate Renal Impairment. Diabetes Ther. 2016 Sep;7(3):527-35. doi: 10.1007/s13300-016-0184-9. Epub 2016 Jul 11.

Bonora E, Bryzinski B, Hirshberg B, Cook W. A post hoc analysis of saxagliptin efficacy and safety in patients with type 2 diabetes stratified by UKPDS 10-year cardiovascular risk score. Nutr Metab Cardiovasc Dis. 2016 May;26(5):374-9. doi: 10.1016/j.numecd.2015.11.004. Epub 2015 Dec 1.

Frederich R, McNeill R, Berglind N, Fleming D, Chen R. The efficacy and safety of the dipeptidyl peptidase-4 inhibitor saxagliptin in treatment-naive patients with type 2 diabetes mellitus: a randomized controlled trial. Diabetol Metab Syndr. 2012 Jul 24;4(1):36. doi: 10.1186/1758-5996-4-36.

groups.title: Saxagliptin 2.5 mg Once in the Morning (QAM)
groups.description: The Saxagliptin 2.5 mg QAM group includes data from subjects randomized to receive administration of blinded Saxagliptin 2.5 mg oral tablets QAM daily.

groups.title: Saxagliptin 5 mg QAM
groups.description: The Saxagliptin 5 mg QAM group includes data from subjects randomized to receive administration of blinded Saxagliptin 5 mg oral tablets QAM daily.

groups.description: The Saxagliptin 2.5/5 mg QAM group includes data from subjects randomized to receive administration of blinded Saxagliptin 2.5 mg oral tablets QAM daily, with possible titration to 5 mg oral tablets QAM.

groups.title: Saxagliptin 5 mg Once in the Evening (QPM)
groups.description: The Saxagliptin 5 mg QPM group includes data from subjects randomized to receive administration of blinded Saxagliptin 5 mg oral tablets QPM daily.

groups.title: Placebo
groups.description: The Placebo group includes data from subjects randomized to receive administration of placebo oral tablets daily.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change From Baseline in Hemoglobin A1 (A1C) at Week 24
outcomeMeasures.description: Mean change from baseline in A1C at Week 24, adjusted for baseline value.
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: Randomized participants who took at least 1 dose of double-blind treatment. To be included in analysis of change from baseline to Week 24 Last Observation Carried Forward (LOCF), participants must have had a baseline and at least 1 post-baseline measurement. If participant received rescue medication, measurement must have been taken before rescue.

certainAgreement.otherDetails: Bristol-Myers Squibb Co. agreements with investigators vary; constant is our right to embargo communications regarding trial results prior to public release for a period ≤60 days from submittal for review. We will not prohibit investigators from publishing, but will prohibit the disclosure of previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results, and request postponement of single-center publications until after disclosure of the clinical trial's primary publication.
